key_responsibilities: Answering constituent letters, including any research necessary to formulate an adequate response to the letters
Developing and maintain a collection of prepared text for use in responding to constituent mail
Drafting form letters to respond to a large number of letters on the same issue
Consulting with the Legislative Director and Legislative Assistants to keep the form letters up to date
Supervising the printing and proofreading of form letters
Drafting responses to constituent mail that cannot be answered with a form letter
Writing and disseminating office newsletter (at least once per week)
Preparing weekly reports to the Congresswoman and staff that provide an update on the mail program and identify emerging trends
requirements: excellent written and verbal communication skills
strong organizational and time management skills
positive attitude and disposition suited to the work environment
solid knowledge of the legislative process
an ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in an fast-paced work environment
experience with Intranet Quorum (IQ)

key_responsibilities: assisting constituents of the 38th Congressional District resolve problems with federal agencies or find the appropriate state or local contact for non-federal issues
meeting with local stakeholders
representing the Congresswoman at community and government events
special projects
general project and event work
maintaining, strengthening, and establishing new relationships with local community stakeholders, non-profit organizations, and local elected officials in the 38th Congressional District
managing projects and large-scale public events
requirements: Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited four-year college or university
Thorough understanding or experience with government agencies (county, state, and federal), community and grassroots organizing

Strong written, communication, analytical, and organizational skills; an ability to relate well with individuals of diverse backgrounds; impeccable customer service manners; and superior public speaking skills
Skilled in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Publisher and Power Point
Able to work efficiently and effectively as a member of a team, be able to meet strict deadlines, balance multiple projects simultaneously, and work under pressure
Positive attitude, commitment to excellence, upbeat demeanor, flexibility, and sense of humor
Enjoy working with the public and constituents
Flexibility to work weekends, some holidays, and after-hours
salary: will depend on the experience of the applicant

making decisions on his/her behalf

detail-oriented

office: House Office of Diversity and Inclusion
key_responsibilities: leading data and research collection and analysis for the Office of Diversity and Inclusion
leading the development of the required diversity report
maintaining key metrics and key performance indicators for the Office
serving as a resource for external and internal diversity best practices

assisting in the translation of research findings into materials that staff can effectively utilize in their engagements with Members and Member offices
providing research support on diversity and inclusion studies, techniques and tools
researching and studying best practices for retention and growth in House employing offices
leading data tracking and reporting with a focus on performance and results
preparing regular updates and briefing documents on research that is relevant to House employing offices
assisting with the development and delivery of training sessions and, as needed, conducting presentations at professional conferences and meetings
requirements: Master’s degree in social or behavioral sciences or related field; or equivalent level of experience providing technical assistance, data collections and/or research
knowledge and experience in diversity, equity, and inclusion research efforts, ideally with a strong background in curriculum development

Quantitative and qualitative evaluation and research skills
